definitions.definition: To be dark, gloomy, and threatening, as clouds; of the sky: to be covered with dark and threatening clouds; to show threatening signs of approach, as a tempest.
To let descend by its own weight, as something suspended; to let down
definitions.example: lower a bucket into a well
lower the aim of a gun
to lower one's ambition, aspirations, or hopes

definitions.definition: To reduce the degree, intensity, strength, etc., of
(lower oneself) To humble oneself; to do something one considers to be beneath one's dignity.
definitions.example: I could never lower myself enough to buy second-hand clothes.

definitions.definition: To reduce (something) in value, amount, etc.
To fall; to sink; to grow less; to diminish; to decrease
definitions.example: The river lowered as rapidly as it rose.

definitions.definition: To decrease in value, amount, etc.
